English name: ROAD MAP, FOCUSED ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF COMPETENCIES
Original name(s): Зерттеу университеттерінің, "Назарбаев Университеті" дербес білім беру ұйымының "Astana Business Campus" хайтек-паркінің және Алматыдағы "Алатау" технопаркінің базасында тиімді ғылыми-инновациялық жүйені құру арқылы смарт-технологиялар, жасанды интеллект, киберфизикалық жүйелер интеграциясы, болашақ энергетикасы, жобалау және инжиниринг саласындағы құзыреттерді дамытуға бағытталған 2016 – 2018 жылдарға арналған жол картасы
Description: Roadmap aimed the development of competencies in the field of smart technologies, artificial intelligence, integration of cyber-physical systems, energy of the future, design and engineering through the construction of an effective scientific and innovative system on the basis of research universities, high-tech Park "Astana Business Campus" Autonomous educational organization "Nazarbayev University" and Technopark "Alatau" in Almaty, for 2016-2018
Objective(s): The development of educational competencies in the field of smart technologies, artificial intelligence, integration of cyber-physical systems, energy of the future, design and engineering.The development of research competencies in the field of smart technologies, artificial intelligence, integration of cyber-physical systems, energy of the future, design and engineering.The development of industrial (professional) competence in the field of smart technologies, artificial intelligence, integration of cyber-physical systems, energy of the future, design and engineering.
Responsible organisation(s): Ministry of Education and Science (MES RK;Қазақстан Республикасы Бiлiм және ғылым министрлігі)
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Degree of coordination in implementing strategy (select the highest that applies): 4- Strategy dictates public bodies' activities or budgets|Focuses on the following area(s) of the national innovation system: Research, Business (innovation and/or entrepreneurship), Education and skills|Follow-up mechanism: Action plan|Foresight exercise included: No|Societal challenge(s) emphasised: None specifically emphasised|Specific business sector(s) targeted: Other services|Strategy mainly prioritises: Digitalisation, Other

English name: ROAD MAP, FOCUSED ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF COMPETENCIES
Original name(s): Зерттеу университеттерінің, "Назарбаев Университеті" дербес білім беру ұйымының "Astana Business Campus" хайтек-паркінің және Алматыдағы "Алатау" технопаркінің базасында тиімді ғылыми-инновациялық жүйені құру арқылы смарт-технологиялар, жасанды интеллект, киберфизикалық жүйелер интеграциясы, болашақ энергетикасы, жобалау және инжиниринг саласындағы құзыреттерді дамытуға бағытталған 2016 – 2018 жылдарға арналған жол картасы
Description: Roadmap aimed the development of competencies in the field of smart technologies, artificial intelligence, integration of cyber-physical systems, energy of the future, design and engineering through the construction of an effective scientific and innovative system on the basis of research universities, high-tech Park "Astana Business Campus" Autonomous educational organization "Nazarbayev University" and Technopark "Alatau" in Almaty, for 2016-2018
Objective(s): The development of educational competencies in the field of smart technologies, artificial intelligence, integration of cyber-physical systems, energy of the future, design and engineering.The development of research competencies in the field of smart technologies, artificial intelligence, integration of cyber-physical systems, energy of the future, design and engineering.The development of industrial (professional) competence in the field of smart technologies, artificial intelligence, integration of cyber-physical systems, energy of the future, design and engineering.
Responsible organisation(s): Ministry of Education and Science (MES RK;Қазақстан Республикасы Бiлiм және ғылым министрлігі)
Policy instrument type: Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts)
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Provides input to: Policy implementation|Study performed by: Public administration|Type of information: Roadmaps

Description: In 2016 the Parliament of the Republic of Kazakhstan ratified a Loan Agreement for the Project "Fostering Productive Innovation” which was signed between the Republic of Kazakhstan and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development. A joint project of the Government of Kazakhstan and the World Bank aimed at strengthening the capacity of key institutions of the national innovation system, suggests the introduction of market mechanisms for the selection and support of innovative projects and technology start-ups, as well as stimulating the participation of the private sector.
Objective(s): The Project on Fostering Productive Innovation aims to promote high-quality, nationally relevant research and commercialization of technologies.
Responsible organisation(s): Science Committee of the Ministry of Education and Science (;Білім және ғылым министрлігінің Ғылым комитеті)
Theme area(s): Emerging trends in STI policy|Innovation in firms and innovative entrepreneurship|Public research system|Research and innovation for society|Science-industry knowledge transfer and sharing
Theme(s): Artificial intelligence (AI)|Collaborative research and innovation|Competitive research funding|Foreign direct investment|Research and innovation for developing countries
Target group type(s): Intermediaries|Research and education organisations|Researchers, students and teachers
Target group(s): Established researchers|Higher education institutes|Incubators, accelerators, science parks or technoparks|Postdocs and other early-career researchers|Private research and development lab|Public research institutes|Technology transfer offices
Policy instrument name: 3 grant programs to fund research group projects focused on high-quality research with commercial potential which will support PhD students
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Maximum amount of grant awarded in euros: 100K-500K|Maximum grant duration: 25-36 months|Requires a form of collaboration: With other public research actors, With industry partners|Selection criteria: Track record of applicant, Commercial impact anticipated, Social inclusion in research (e.g. women and other under-represented groups)|Success rate (share of grants awarded as a % of total applications): Too early to estimate|Type of activity: Applied research, Multidisciplinary research, Experimental development|Type(s) of proposal screening: Internal: review by grant manager (e.g. funding agency), External peer review: including members of the scientific community, External peer review: including research users and stakeholders

Description: In 2016 the Parliament of the Republic of Kazakhstan ratified a Loan Agreement for the Project "Fostering Productive Innovation” which was signed between the Republic of Kazakhstan and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development. A joint project of the Government of Kazakhstan and the World Bank aimed at strengthening the capacity of key institutions of the national innovation system, suggests the introduction of market mechanisms for the selection and support of innovative projects and technology start-ups, as well as stimulating the participation of the private sector.
Objective(s): The Project on Fostering Productive Innovation aims to promote high-quality, nationally relevant research and commercialization of technologies.
Responsible organisation(s): Science Committee of the Ministry of Education and Science (;Білім және ғылым министрлігінің Ғылым комитеті)
Theme area(s): Emerging trends in STI policy|Innovation in firms and innovative entrepreneurship|Public research system|Research and innovation for society|Science-industry knowledge transfer and sharing
Theme(s): Artificial intelligence (AI)|Collaborative research and innovation|Competitive research funding|Foreign direct investment|Research and innovation for developing countries
Target group type(s): Intermediaries|Research and education organisations|Researchers, students and teachers
Target group(s): Established researchers|Higher education institutes|Incubators, accelerators, science parks or technoparks|Postdocs and other early-career researchers|Private research and development lab|Public research institutes|Technology transfer offices
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Funding used for: Gaining access to existing international infrastructures, Training research and technical staff, Building knowledge repositories of scientific data and archives|Main focus of support: National infrastructure(s)|Objective(s): Promote partnerships among HEIs/PRIs, Foster science-industry collaboration, Address societal or environmental challenges

English name: PhD RESEARCH AND TRAINING GRANT PROGRAM
Original name(s): Постдокторанттардың (PhD) зерттеулері мен тренингтерін қолдауға тағайындалатын гранттық бағдарламасы
Description: Grants are awarded to projects addressing strategic issues related to the future of Kazakhstan in priority areas of scientific and technological development defined by Higher Scientific-Technical Commission under the Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
Objective(s): To train researchers, research engineers, constructors and designers of industrial enterprises of the Republic of Kazakhstan.To develop priority area of scientific and technological development on Digital services, 3D printing, automation, robotics, artificial intelligence, nanotechnology and big data.
Responsible organisation(s): Project on Fostering Productive Innovation (;Өнімді инновацияларды ынталандыру жобасы)|Science Committee of the Ministry of Education and Science (;Білім және ғылым министрлігінің Ғылым комитеті)
Theme area(s): Emerging trends in STI policy|Human resources for research and innovation
Theme(s): Artificial intelligence (AI)|Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers|Nano and converging technology flagships
Target group type(s): Intermediaries|Research and education organisations|Researchers, students and teachers
Target group(s): Established researchers|Higher education institutes|PhD students|Postdocs and other early-career researchers|Private research and development lab|Public research institutes|Technology transfer offices
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Maximum amount of grant awarded in euros: Less than 100K|Maximum grant duration: 25-36 months|Requires a form of collaboration: With other public research actors, With industry partners|Selection criteria: Track record of applicant, Scientific impact anticipated, Commercial impact anticipated, The participation of early-career researchers, Alignment with national research priorities|Success rate (share of grants awarded as a % of total applications): Too early to estimate|Type of activity: Applied research, Experimental development, Demonstration / testing|Type(s) of proposal screening: Internal: review by grant manager (e.g. funding agency), External peer review: including members of the scientific community

English name: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT SUPPORT FUND
Original name(s): Жасанды интеллектті зерттеу және дамытуды қолдау қоры
Description: The Fund was created to attract the world's leading manufacturers of artificial intelligence solutions to the Republic of Kazakhstan.
Objective(s): To develop artificial intelligence in Kazakhstan in the educational, research, scientific, technical, social, cultural, charitable, innovative, managerial spheres, sustainable development and other socially useful areas.
Target group(s): Established researchers|Postdocs and other early-career researchers
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Funding used for: Increasing user access to infrastructure, Building computing systems and virtual infrastructures|Main focus of support: National infrastructure(s)|Objective(s): Promote partnerships among HEIs/PRIs
